summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/02/01 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English (UK) [CC]', 'English (US) [CC]', 'Deutsch'], 'Directors': ['Charles McDougall'], 'Producers': ['Shawn Ryan', 'Cris Cole'], 'Starring': ['Ben Chaplin', 'Michael Imperioli', 'Romany Malco']} Review Text: The only way to improve this reck of a series would be for the four protagonists to die in the first scene, then rebroadcast nine and a half episodes of the 'ant races' that broadcast after the National Anthem on late night TV in the 70s. Yes, it is that bad. I went about 4 episodes waiting for the good part. Save yourself, follow Nancy's advice, "just say NO!" Review Title: Just say NO! Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/06/07 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'sexual content'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Niall MacCormick'], 'Producers': ['Helen Gregory'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: we loved this movie! Good story, great cinematography. All around several good evenings of entertainment.
I have read a lot of classic literature, I really like the writing style of novels of this period. Oddly enough I had somehow bypassed Anthony Trollope. Consider that deficit lacking, I now have the Anthony Trollope anthology from Amazon for Kindle. Review Title: good series and bought the book! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/02/05 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Deutsch', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Français', 'हिन्दी', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português', 'Русский', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Tim Blake Nelson', 'Mike Barker', 'Neasa Hardiman', 'Minkie Spiro', 'Wash Westmoreland'], 'Producers': ['Antonia Elli', 'Christina Ricci', 'Christine Vachon', 'Dawn Prestwich', 'Ian Deithman Kristin', 'Kathy Ciric', 'Lydia Woodward', 'Mike Barker', 'Minkie Spiro', 'Neasa Hardiman', 'Nicole Yorkin', 'Pamela Koffler', 'Rusk Robinson', 'Theresa Anne Fowler', 'Tim Blake Nelson', 'Wash Westmoreland'], 'Starring': ['Christina Ricci', 'David Hoflin']} Review Text: the most fun and the wife and I have on TV for a while! JUST WATCH IT!
(and when the heck is the Good Girls Revolt coming back!!) Review Title: JUST WATCH IT! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Empire Falls Review Date: 2017/03/13 Categories: Drama, Romance Product Description: ['[HBO] HBO Miniseries about the hidden ties that connect various residents of a fading New England town.'] Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Starring': ['Ed Harris', 'Philip Seymour Hoffman', 'Helen Hunt']} Review Text: It's more like what happened than a story. Like I got up, I ate breakfast, I went to work, I came home. I wasn't interested in any of the characters or really what happened to them. The best thing I could say about it was that Paul Newman is still interesting, even though it was a bit part. It might have been bore you to tears highbrow literature that I don't understand, but it probably was just mediocre.

I went back and forth between 2 or 3 stars - between 'I don't like it' and 'it's OK'. 2 won but if there was a meh, I would have chose that. Review Title: I got up, I ate breakfast, I came home, the end. Rating: 2.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:
The individual exhibits a clear divide in preferences when consuming media, reflected in their ratings and sentiments. They demonstrate enthusiasm for engaging narratives and high production values, shown by their positive sentiments towards enjoyable films that evoke strong storytelling emotions, leading to higher ratings (5.0). However, they display severe discontent with monotonous or poorly constructed plots, as seen in their low ratings (1.0 - 2.0) for series perceived as lacking substance or entertainment.

Common themes emerge around genres characterized by drama and romance, as well as a strong interest in classic literature adaptations. The individual's purchase decisions are also influenced by the overall quality of the content, indicated by their focus on productions with robust cinematography and narrative depth.

Quality preferences lean towards well-rated media with substantial artistic merit, while they demonstrate a low tolerance for mediocrity and boredom, frequently articulating dissatisfaction with unengaging material. Price sensitivity appears minimal; they are willing to invest in media that promise quality and emotional engagement, suggesting a focus on value rather than cost.

In summary, the individual strongly prefers emotionally compelling and high-quality narratives, particularly in the drama and romance categories, and has a low tolerance for mundane or poorly crafted content, reflecting a discerning consumer mindset.

target_interaction.title: Just say no!
target_interaction.text: The Emperor has no Clothes! Could it be any worse? Like watching a YouTube video made by a stoned freshman and ogled by a bunch of Wayne's World chactacter rejects. We would need to get into negative star ratings to give Twin Drivel it's due.
